content.question: ​The periodic function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has a period of <math alttext="pi"><semantics><mi>π</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following could define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="tan open parentheses 1 half x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="tan open parentheses pi x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
